instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
threads.message: Board came in very liquid damaged. Replaced everything on the top of the board for 3v42, replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> (was blown), the ISL and all controller fets (thinking it could pull DC in down as it did on a board I fixed yesterday), and ultrasoniced. Also touched up J9500 area of corrosion, and STILL only 3.1 volts on DC in. I'm completely out of ideas on what could be causing this no short on DC in or 3v42 or PPBUS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
threads.message: Oh and for sure known good magsafe board and flat cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
threads.message: Ok so Zenner diode was preventing DC in. Replaced and DC in back. Now to figure out the rest of this. I'll report back if I run into any other issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
threads.message: Aaaaaand it ends up being a bad SMC. Smh for this customer we don't do SMC's, so you can close this, but that's what's up with this. I guess if you're missing PPDCIN on these ALWAYS check your zenner diode! Always a chance it's bad!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.1 volts on DC in very weird one.
threads.message: The DC in part of this is fixed I now have voltage on it. The SMC is dead tho, and with this customer, we don't do SMC repairs.
